Class a1.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • a1.Builder

  • public class a1.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    A Player who modifies the map
    Manages an inventory of a1.Blocks
    Maintains a position in the map (by maintaining the current tile that the a1.Builder is on)

      Create a builder
      Set the name of the a1.Builder (such that getName() == name) and the current tile to startingTile (such that getCurrentTile() == startingTile).

    • Constructor Detail

      • a1.Builder

        public a1.Builder(java.lang.String name,
               a1.Tile startingTile)
        Create a builder.
        Set the name of the a1.Builder (such that getName() == name) and the current tile to startingTile (such that getCurrentTile() == startingTile).
        Parameters:
        name - name of the builder (returned by getName())- cannot be null
        startingTile - the tile the builder starts in - cannot be null

      • a1.Builder

        public a1.Builder(java.lang.String name,
               a1.Tile startingTile,
               java.util.List<a1.Block> startingInventory)
        throws a1.InvalidBlockException
        Create a builder
        Set the name of the a1.Builder (such that getName() == name) and the current tile to startingTile (such that getCurrentTile() == startingTile).
        Copy the starting inventory into the builder's inventory, such that the contents of getInventory() are identical to startingInventory.
        i.e. getInventory() must contain the contents of startingInventory, but modifying startingInventory after the a1.Builder is constructed should not change the result of getInventory().
        Parameters:
        name - name of the builder (returned by getName()) - cannot be null
        startingTile - the tile the builder starts in - cannot be null
        startingInventory - the starting inventory (blocks) - cannot be null
        Throws:
        a1.InvalidBlockException - if for any a1.Block (block) in startingInventory, block.isCarryable() == false

      • dropFromInventory

        public void dropFromInventory(int inventoryIndex)
                       throws a1.InvalidBlockException,
                              a1.TooHighException
        Drop a block from inventory on the top of the current tile
        The block at inventoryIndex should be removed from the a1.Builder's inventory, and added to the a1.Builder's current tile.
        Blocks can only be dropped on tiles with less than 8 blocks, or tiles with less than 3 blocks if a a1.GroundBlock.
        Note: the current tile is that given by getCurrentTile() and the index should refer to an item in the list returned by getInventory()
        Handle the following cases:
        1. If the inventoryIndex is < 0 or ≥ the inventory size, throw an a1.InvalidBlockException.
        2. If there are 8 blocks on the current tile, throw a a1.TooHighException.
        3. If there are 3 or more blocks on the current tile, and the inventory block is a a1.GroundBlock, throw a a1.TooHighException
        Hint: call a1.Tile.placeBlock, after checking the inventory
        Parameters:
        inventoryIndex - the index in the inventory to place
        Throws:
        a1.InvalidBlockException - if the inventoryIndex is out of the inventory range
        a1.TooHighException - if there are 8 blocks on the current tile already, or if the block is an instance of a1.GroundBlock and there are already 3 or more blocks on the current tile.

      • digOnCurrentTile

        public void digOnCurrentTile()
                      throws a1.TooLowException,
                             a1.InvalidBlockException
        Attempt to dig in the current tile and add tile to the inventory
        If the top block (given by getCurrentTile().getTopBlock()) is diggable, remove the top block of the tile and destroy it, or add it to the end of the inventory (given by getInventory()).
        Handle the following cases:
        1. If there are no blocks on the current tile, throw a a1.TooLowException
        2. If the top block is not diggable, throw a a1.InvalidBlockException
        3. If the top block is not carryable, remove the block, but do not add it to the inventory.
        Hint: call a1.Tile.dig()
        Throws:
        a1.TooLowException - if there are no blocks on the current tile.
        a1.InvalidBlockException - if the top block is not diggable

      • canEnter

        public boolean canEnter(a1.Tile newTile)
        Check if the a1.Builder can enter a tile from the current tile.
        Returns true if:
        1. the tiles are connected via an exit (i.e. there is an exit from the current tile to the new tile), and
        2. the height of the new tile (number of blocks) is the same or different by 1 from the current tile (i.e. abs(current tile height - new tile) <= 1)
        If newTile is null return false.
        Parameters:
        newTile - the tile to test if we can enter
        Returns:
        true if the tile can be entered

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(a1.Tile newTile)
            throws a1.NoExitException
        move the builder to a new tile.
        If canEnter(newTile) == true then change the builders current tile to be newTile. (i.e. getCurrentTile() == newTile)
        If canEnter(newTile) == false then throw a a1.NoExitException.
        Parameters:
        newTile - the tile to move to
        Throws:
        a1.NoExitException - if canEnter(newTile) == false
